name: Uncanny Dodge II v1.74+ and flanking sneaks in practice
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi all
I know this is a topic I am very interested in, and Web was interested in too.

v1.74 added a check where if the attacker had 4 less rogue, assassin and barbarian levels combined than the defender, then sneak attacks would not occur from flanking.
They will occur if the opponent is flatfooted.
Blackguard sneak attacks do not count, neither do shadowdancer levels (shadowdancer has Uncanny Dodge)

Just was curious when you are noticing when this starts to become a factor for your rogue sneaker who may start to have trouble landing sneaks on enemies with flanking.
For me I have noticed it around level 16-17 against pure rogue enemies, for a rogue who has some multiclass into a full BAB class like fighter (ie. She is rogue 12/Fighter 3/Paladin 2 right now)
I am thinking, as a general guide, perhaps once your rogue/assassin/barb levels combine drop 4 levels below your class level or more this becomes an issue

Also could this see the rise of the rogue/barbarian build as the best rogue sneaker build?
More power for half-orcs? :)
The sneaker to end all sneakers? (quite literally *end* them )

Hope you guys are having a good time during this rough time.
Also hope we are doing Mick proud with all this sneaker talk.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
v1.74 added a check where if the attacker had 4 less rogue, assassin and barbarian levels combined than the defender, then sneak attacks would not occur from flanking.
This is not formulated correctly.  It should be :
As of Enhanced Edition patch 1.74, uncanny dodge II grants immunity to sneak attacks from a flanking attacker unless the attacker has at least four more combined class levels of rogue, assassin, and barbarian than the defender. (Shadowdancer and blackguard levels are not counted.) For example, a level 10 rogue would have this immunity when attacked by a level 13 rogue, but not when attacked by a level 14 rogue. This immunity does not apply when the defender is flat-footed. This change is undocumented in the feat description.
So it should be :

v1.74 added a check where if the attacker had at least 4 MORE rogue, assassin and barbarian levels combined than the defender, then sneak attacks would occur from flanking.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
As to where I have noticed it - from level 2 to around level 32 or so (in the environment where I play - YMMV).  After that, only certain builds (Barb/Rog, etc) have been resistant from SA.

The problem is that my character has to have at least a 4 level advantage in the combined classes over what I am fighting.  In the environment where I play, being that high a level over opponents results in very little XP gained.

It only gets worse in Party play - where one can reasonably expect to be able to take on opponents well over your level.

To put this in perspective - before, only those crit immunes (like Undead, Constructs, Elementals, etc) were really safe from SA.  Now, any opponent who has enough levels combined (that is the real hammer) of Barb/Rog/Ass, is safe at least from flanking SA.

Now, it is true that one can "manipulate" this to one's favor with various tactics.  But that means "jumping through more hoops" in most of the cases.  Uses of KD/IKD now are more important to have, as is Stunning Fist now.  I think HiPS is also more important now in helping generate sustained SAs.  DA's para is now very useful for generating SAs without having any penalties.

The KD feats have the -4 attack penalty, of course, and IKD has the added "must have 13+ Int" attached to it.  The same -4 attack (and damage in this case) applies to Stunning Fist (not to mention the prereqs).

Of course, one can get SF, KD, IKD with Monk levels, but then sacrifices levels in one of the three classes necessary for the flanking opportunites.

In the environment where I play, where there have been many recent nerfs to UMD, this has made things more difficult for low-level Rogue builds to effectively use SA as a damage generator.  No using Darkness scrolls+Ultravision anymore, and no Improved Invis (one will have to be content to use Invis potions or any items found).
